item.title: Megan add a quote by Emma Donoghue
item.description: "In the world I notice persons are nearly always stressed and have no time...I don't know how persons with jobs do the jobs and all the living as well...I guess the time gets spread very thin like butter all over the world, the roads and houses and playgrounds and stores, so there's only a little smear of time on each place, then everyone has to hurry on to the next bit." -- Emma Donoghue

item.title: Megan add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Megan add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "We laugh and laugh, and nothing can ever be sad, no one can be lost, or dead, or far away: right now we are here, and nothing can mar our perfection, or steal the joy of this perfect moment." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Megan add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Long ago, men went to sea, and women waited for them, standing on the edge of the water, scanning the horizon for the tiny ship. Now I wait for Henry. He vanishes unwillingly, without warning. I wait for him. Each moment that I wait feels like a year, an eternity. Each moment is as slow and transparent as glass. Through each moment I can see infinite moments lined up, waiting. Why has he gone where I cannot follow?" -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Megan add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "I'm sorry. I didn't know you were coming or I'd have cleaned up a little more. My life, I mean, not just the apartment." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Megan add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "I am suddenly comsumed by nostalgia for the little girl who was me, who loved the fields and believed in God, who spent winter days home sick from school reading Nancy Drew and sucking menthol cough drops, who could keep a secret." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Megan add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "I place my hands over her ears and tip her head back, and kiss her, and try to put my heart into hers, for safekeeping, in case I lose it again." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Megan add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "‎I never wanted to have anything in my life that I couldn't stand losing. But it's too late for that." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Megan add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "I sit quietly and think about my mom. It's funny how memory erodes, If all I had to work from were my childhood memories, my knowledge of my mother would be faded and soft, with a few sharp memories standing out." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "Perhaps," said the man, "you would like to be lost with us. I have found it much more agreeable to be lost in the company of others." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Megan add a quote by Vanessa Diffenbaugh
item.description: "Anyone can grow into something beautiful." -- Vanessa Diffenbaugh

item.title: Megan add a quote by Vanessa Diffenbaugh
item.description: "In that moment, we were the same, each of us destroyed by our limited understanding of reality." -- Vanessa Diffenbaugh

item.title: Megan add a quote by Vanessa Diffenbaugh
item.description: "Common thistle is everywhere,” she said. “Which is perhaps why human beings are so relentlessly unkind to one another." -- Vanessa Diffenbaugh

item.title: Megan add a quote by Vanessa Diffenbaugh
item.description: "It wasn't as if the flowers themselves held within them the ability to bring an abstract definition into physical reality. Instead, it seemed that...expecting change, and the very belief in the possibility instigated a transformation." -- Vanessa Diffenbaugh

item.title: Megan add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description: "The world turns on our every action, and our every omission, whether we know it or not." -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Megan add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description: "She died chasing greatness and never saw it each time it was in her hand, so she kept seeking it elsewhere, but never understood the work required to get it or to keep it." -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Never be so focused on what you're looking for that you overlook the thing you actually find." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Some people are born to make great art and others are born to appreciate it. … It is a kind of talent in itself, to be an audience, whether you are the spectator in the gallery or you are listening to the voice of the world's greatest soprano. Not everyone can be the artist. There have to be those who witness the art, who love and appreciate what they have been privileged to see." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Hope is a horrible thing, you know. I don't know who decided to package hope as a virtue because it's not. It's a plague. Hope is like walking around with a fishhook in your mouth and somebody just keeps pulling it and pulling it." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It was never the right time or it was always the right time, depending on how you looked at it." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "No one tells the truth to people they don't actually know, and if they do it is a horrible trait. Everyone wants something smaller, something neater than the truth." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "The kind of love that offers its life so easily, so stupidly, is always the love that is not returned." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Megan add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "The quality of gifts depends on the sincerity of the giver." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Megan add a quote by David Benioff
item.description: "There are a few moments in your life when you are truly and completely happy, and you remember to give thanks. Even as it happens you are nostalgic for the moment, you are tucking it away in your scrapbook." -- David Benioff

item.title: Megan add a quote by Benjamin Alire Sáenz
item.description: "To be careful with people and with words was a rare and beautiful thing." -- Benjamin Alire Sáenz

item.title: Megan add a quote by Benjamin Alire Sáenz
item.description: "I got to thinking that poems were like people. Some people you got right off the bat. Some people you just didn't get--and never would get." -- Benjamin Alire Sáenz

item.title: Megan add a quote by Benjamin Alire Sáenz
item.description: "I had a feeling there was something wrong with me. I guess I was a mystery even to myself." -- Benjamin Alire Sáenz

item.title: Megan add a quote by Benjamin Alire Sáenz
item.description: "I had a rule that it was better to be bored by yourself than to be bored with someone else. I pretty much lived by that rule. Maybe that's why I didn't have any friends." -- Benjamin Alire Sáenz

item.title: Megan add a quote by Benjamin Alire Sáenz
item.description: "Sometimes, all you have to do is tell people the truth. They won't believe you. After that, they'll leave you alone." -- Benjamin Alire Sáenz
